description:
After killing his daughter’s abusive yakuza boyfriend to save her, ordinary salaryman Tetsuo Tosu becomes embroiled in the dark criminal underworld. The wish for a simple life he and his wife Kasen had for their daughter has been reduced to a wish for survival. Though middle-aged and weak, he’ll put his life on the line using only his wits in order to protect his family.

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Yakuza
tags.description: Centered around Japanese organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Mafia
tags.description: Centered around Italian organised crime syndicates.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Fugitive
tags.description: Prominently features a character evading capture by an individual or organization.

tags.name: Family Life
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a family unit.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: Criminal Organization
tags.description: Prominently features a group of people who commit crimes for illicit or violent purposes.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: Denpa
tags.description: Works that feature themes of social dissociation, delusions, and other issues like suicide, bullying, self-isolation, paranoia, and technological necessity in daily lives. Classic iconography: telephone poles, rooftops, and trains.

node.description:
**Graduated:** Hiroshima University
**Major:** Art

__Kouhei Kiyasu__ is a Japanese voice actor, seiyuu and singer, who also does script/screenwriting and series composition for anime. He is a member of the theater troupe [Nylon 100℃](http://www.sillywalk.com/nylon/) alongside Inuyama Inuko, Ookura Kouji and Shintani Mayumi. He is also the chairman of his own troupe called _Bull Docking Headlock_ (ブルドッキングヘッドロック).

**Graduated:** Hiroshima University
**Major:** Art

__Kouhei Kiyasu__ is a Japanese voice actor, seiyuu and singer, who also does script/screenwriting and series composition for anime. He is a member of the theater troupe [Nylon 100℃](http://www.sillywalk.com/nylon/) alongside Inuyama Inuko, Ookura Kouji and Shintani Mayumi. He is also the chairman of his own troupe called _Bull Docking Headlock_ (ブルドッキングヘッドロック).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Chom2Start)  |  [SOUL OF JOE (fansite)](http://soulofjoe.jp/index.html)

Currently working for Studio M2.

He's an Ashita no Joe ''collector'' and fan and has contributed to books, TV programs, museums and more. He is also an administrator of the fansite ''SOUL OF JOE''.

Yukio Abe is a veteran art director that worked on creating visual concepts for later anime adaptations of Osamu Tezuka's manga.  Notably, he also worked with such anime directors as Masami Hata, the Dezaki brothers and character designer Sugino Akio.  Abe's works mostly consist of kodomo anime. His art style perfectly compliments children's stories creating beatiful, warm and fairy tale-like settings.

_Note: Not to be confused with the [audio engineer](https://anilist.co/staff/116191/)._

[Website](http://www.kenjikawai.com/index_e.html) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%B7%9D%E4%BA%95%E6%86%B2%E6%AC%A1)

After dropping out of a nuclear engineering program at Tokai University, Kawai Kenji began studying music at Shobi Music Academy. However, he dropped out after half a year. With a few friends, he created the band Muse, playing fusion rock and participating in music competitions. Through competing in such contests, the band members became technically competent to enter the music industry and decided to part ways.

After leaving Muse, Kawai Kenji began composing music for commercials in his home studio. While recording music for [Yuji Mitsuya](https://anilist.co/staff/95874/) he met music director Naoko Asari, who advised him to compose anime soundtracks. Some of his most famous anime soundtracks can be found in [Patlabor](https://anilist.co/anime/1288/), [Ranma ½](https://anilist.co/anime/210/), [Ghost in the Shell](https://anilist.co/anime/43/), [Fate/Stay Night](https://anilist.co/anime/356/), [When They Cry](https://anilist.co/anime/934/) and more recently in [Mob Psycho 100](https://anilist.co/anime/21507/).

He has worked on several projects with the director [Mamoru Oshii](https://anilist.co/staff/99097/) and has written scores for all of Hideo Nakata's films. Kenji Kawai's music has received the Annie award and Hong Kong Film Award in 2005, for [Ghost in The Shell 2: Innocence](https://anilist.co/anime/468/) he was nominated for an Annie award.

Following his success as an anime music composer, he became involved in live action movies. He contributed music to horror films: Ring, Ring 2, Dark Water, Japanese-Polish science-fiction film Avalon and the Hong Kong film Seven Swords.

For the music found in Seven Swords and A Battle of Wits he was nominated for Best Original Film Score Awards at both the 25th and 26th Hong Kong Film Awards in 2006 and 2007.

(Source: AniDB)

[Profile](http://www.ariamusic.co.jp/elements-garden/fujinaga/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ryutarofujinaga)

A music lyricist, composer, and arranger, part of the group [Elements Garden](https://anilist.co/staff/109605).

[Profile](http://www.ariamusic.co.jp/elements-garden/fujinaga/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/ryutarofujinaga)

A music lyricist, composer, and arranger, part of the group [Elements Garden](https://anilist.co/staff/109605).

__[Website](https://fujikawachiai.com/profile/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Nippon Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/artist-info/fujikawachiai/prof.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujikawachiai)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/fujikawa_chiai/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPn4XA6Gb2u8y_FXXtrHW7w)__

__Height:__ 162 cm
__Graduated:__ Okayama Prefectural Kasaoka Commercial High School

__Introduction:__
Chiai Fujikawa is a Japanese vocalist and lyricist under record label Nippon Columbia (2018-). Before going solo she was a lead singer in the idol group Maneki Kecak, between July of 2015 until her departure from the group in September of 2018. She has additionally performed at the Nippon Budokan, which took place on September 24 of 2018.

Activities as a solo artist began after debuting at "TOKYO CULTURE CULTURE", where she held an Acoustic Live event on November 25 of 2018, this was followed-up with her first album release on May of 2019, titled "Raika".

__Biography:__
After graduating high school, Chiai aimed to become a singer while working at a factory. She mentions how she wanted to write her own lyrics whenever she became an artist, so she had been writing poems in her notebooks since she was a student. Whenever she came up with a word, sentence, or anything that could be used in a song, she would write it in a notepad she kept on her phone.

__[Website](https://fujikawachiai.com/profile/)__ | __[Artist Profile (Nippon Columbia)](https://columbia.jp/artist-info/fujikawachiai/prof.html)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/fujikawachiai)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/fujikawa_chiai/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCPn4XA6Gb2u8y_FXXtrHW7w)__

__Height:__ 162 cm
__Graduated:__ Okayama Prefectural Kasaoka Commercial High School

__Introduction:__
Chiai Fujikawa is a Japanese vocalist and lyricist under record label Nippon Columbia (2018-). Before going solo she was a lead singer in the idol group Maneki Kecak, between July of 2015 until her departure from the group in September of 2018. She has additionally performed at the Nippon Budokan, which took place on September 24 of 2018.

Activities as a solo artist began after debuting at "TOKYO CULTURE CULTURE", where she held an Acoustic Live event on November 25 of 2018, this was followed-up with her first album release on May of 2019, titled "Raika".

__Biography:__
After graduating high school, Chiai aimed to become a singer while working at a factory. She mentions how she wanted to write her own lyrics whenever she became an artist, so she had been writing poems in her notebooks since she was a student. Whenever she came up with a word, sentence, or anything that could be used in a song, she would write it in a notepad she kept on her phone.

__[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/punkdizzyrock/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ayapettan)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayapettan/)__

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan

__Ayapeta__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, guitarist and member of the rock band [Dizzy Sunfist](https://twitter.com/_dizzy_sunfist_). On May 24, 2018, she announced her marriage with [UVERworld](https://anilist.co/staff/101608) guitarist [Akira](https://anilist.co/staff/296788).

__[Blog (JP)](https://ameblo.jp/punkdizzyrock/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ayapettan)__ | __[Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayapettan/)__

__Birthplace:__ Osaka Prefecture, Japan

__Ayapeta__ is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, guitarist and member of the rock band [Dizzy Sunfist](https://twitter.com/_dizzy_sunfist_). On May 24, 2018, she announced her marriage with [UVERworld](https://anilist.co/staff/101608) guitarist [Akira](https://anilist.co/staff/296788).

__[Website](https://dizzy-sunfist.com) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_Dizzy_Sunfist_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/dizzysunfist_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtLYoRYXQsLlTUAqvd_H3WQ)__

Dizzy Sunfist, is a three-piece Japanese punk rock. The band was formed in 2009 by Ayapeta and Iyama when they were in high school.

__Members:__
- [Ayapeta](https://anilist.co/staff/164247/) (あやぺた) – Vocals, Guitar (2009–)
- moAi – Drums, Chorus (2012–)
- Meiko (メイ子) – Bass. Chorus (2022–)

__Former Member:__
- Iyama (いやま) – Vocals, Bass (2009–2021)

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/drumoAi) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/drumoai)__

Moai, stylized as moAi, is a Japanese drummer and member of Japanese punk rock band, Dizzy Sunfist.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Chom2Start)  |  [SOUL OF JOE (fansite)](http://soulofjoe.jp/index.html)

Currently working for Studio M2.

He's an Ashita no Joe ''collector'' and fan and has contributed to books, TV programs, museums and more. He is also an administrator of the fansite ''SOUL OF JOE''.
